intro: Jupunba zolleriana, commonly known as the Zoller's jupunba, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and prefers well-drained soil. It is known for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage and delicate blooms. However, it is relatively rare and faces threats from habitat loss and climate change.
